title: Could not connect to the node. Refresh your page, try a different node (upper right corner), check your firewall settings. If custom node, check your configs.
body: *Github issues are primarily for reporting bugs or getting assistance with development-related items. If you have a question or need support with our product, please email support@mycrypto.com for faster attention.* *If you are reporting an issue, please use the template below so we can reproduce, determine the cause of the issue, and fix it! If you are not reporting an issue, delete this entire thing and type away. Thanks!* --- ### Description of Issue ... Hi... i have not be able to add my custome node in the network. I follow the instructions and i still having the following error: **Could not connect to the node. Refresh your page, try a different node (upper right corner), check your firewall settings. If custom node, check your configs.** I have been installing, uninstalling the app... trying many things and I am very frustrated with this ... could you help to fix the issue? Thank you, S '''Last login: Sun Jan 19 15:38:16 on ttys003 (base) sandranomo@x86_64-apple-darwin13 ~ % cd Desktop/zbankblockchain (base) sandranomo@x86_64-apple-darwin13 zbankblockchain % mkdir node1 node2 (base) sandranomo@x86_64-apple-darwin13 zbankblockchain % ./geth account new --datadir node1 ./geth account new --datadir node2 INFO [01-19|16:07:02.133] Maximum peer count ETH=50 LES=0 total=50 Your new account is locked with a password. Please give a password. Do not forget this password. Password: Repeat password: Your new key was generated Public address of the key: 0xa60a89799e088DCc2733CE31ed0B3C1c5d8DCF65 Path of the secret key file: node1/keystore/UTC--2020-01-19T21-07-20.574786000Z--a60a89799e088dcc2733ce31ed0b3c1c5d8dcf65 - You can share your public address with anyone. Others need it to interact with you. - You must NEVER share the secret key with anyone! The key controls access to your funds! - You must BACKUP your key file! Without the key, it's impossible to access account funds! - You must REMEMBER your password! Without the password, it's impossible to decrypt the key! INFO [01-19|16:07:22.243] Maximum peer count ETH=50 LES=0 total=50 Your new account is locked with a password. Please give a password. Do not forget this password. Password: Repeat password: Your new key was generated Public address of the key: 0xFca2039285e48E91eac6412139215fF32827847E Path of the secret key file: node2/keystore/UTC--2020-01-19T21-07-31.589651000Z--fca2039285e48e91eac6412139215ff32827847e - You can share your public address with anyone. Others need it to interact with you. - You must NEVER share the secret key with anyone! The key controls access to your funds! - You must BACKUP your key file! Without the key, it's impossible to access account funds! - You must REMEMBER your password! Without the password, it's impossible to decrypt the key! (base) sandranomo@x86_64-apple-darwin13 zbankblockchain % echo '0xa60a89799e088DCc2733CE31ed0B3C1c5d8DCF65' > node1/account.txt (base) sandranomo@x86_64-apple-darwin13 zbankblockchain % echo '0xFca2039285e48E91eac6412139215fF32827847E' > node2/account.txt (base) sandranomo@x86_64-apple-darwin13 zbankblockchain % echo 'Nana2511' > node1/password.txt (base) sandranomo@x86_64-apple-darwin13 zbankblockchain % echo 'Caju2511' > node2/password.txt (base) sandranomo@x86_64-apple-darwin13 zbankblockchain %''' Last login: Sun Jan 19 15:47:00 on ttys000 (base) sandranomo@x86_64-apple-darwin13 zbankblockchain % ./puppeth +-----------------------------------------------------------+ | Welcome to puppeth, your Ethereum private network manager | | | | This tool lets you create a new Ethereum network down to | | the genesis block, bootnodes, miners and ethstats servers | | without the hassle that it would normally entail. | | | | Puppeth uses SSH to dial in to remote servers, and builds | | its network components out of Docker containers using the | | docker-compose toolset. | +-----------------------------------------------------------+ Please specify a network name to administer (no spaces, hyphens or capital letters please) > zbash Sweet, you can set this via --network=zbash next time! INFO [01-19|16:22:05.957] Administering Ethereum network name=zbash WARN [01-19|16:22:05.964] No previous configurations found path=/Users/sandranomo/.puppeth/zbash What would you like to do? (default = stats) 1. Show network stats 2. Configure new genesis 3. Track new remote server 4. Deploy network components > 2 What would you like to do? (default = create) 1. Create new genesis from scratch 2. Import already existing genesis > 1 Which consensus engine to use? (default = clique) 1. Ethash - proof-of-work 2. Clique - proof-of-authority > 2 How many seconds should blocks take? (default = 15) > 15 Which accounts are allowed to seal? (mandatory at least one) > 0xa60a89799e088DCc2733CE31ed0B3C1c5d8DCF65 > 0xFca2039285e48E91eac6412139215fF32827847E > 0x Which accounts should be pre-funded? (advisable at least one) > 0xa60a89799e088DCc2733CE31ed0B3C1c5d8DCF65 > 0xFca2039285e48E91eac6412139215fF32827847E > 0x Should the precompile-addresses (0x1 .. 0xff) be pre-funded with 1 wei? (advisable yes) > yes Specify your chain/network ID if you want an explicit one (default = random) > 123 INFO [01-19|16:37:06.699] Configured new genesis block What would you like to do? (default = stats) 1. Show network stats 2. Manage existing genesis 3. Track new remote server 4. Deploy network components > 2 1. Modify existing configurations 2. Export genesis configurations 3. Remove genesis configuration > 2 Which folder to save the genesis specs into? (default = current) Will create zbash.json, zbash-aleth.json, zbash-harmony.json, zbash-parity.json > INFO [01-19|16:37:21.933] Saved native genesis chain spec path=zbash.json ERROR[01-19|16:37:21.934] Failed to create Aleth chain spec err="unsupported consensus engine" ERROR[01-19|16:37:21.934] Failed to create Parity chain spec err="unsupported consensus engine" INFO [01-19|16:37:21.938] Saved genesis chain spec client=harmony path=zbash-harmony.json What would you like to do? (default = stats) 1. Show network stats 2. Manage existing genesis 3. Track new remote server 4. Deploy network components _______________________________________________ 1) ./geth --networkid 123 --datadir node1 --rpc --unlock "0xa60a89799e088DCc2733CE31ed0B3C1c5d8DCF65" --password node1/password.txt --allow-insecure-unlock --mine --minerthreads 1 2) ./geth --datadir node2 --unlock "0xFca2039285e48E91eac6412139215fF32827847E" --mine --port 30304 --bootnodes enode://5f83736e2c2bf71675b53a3b0250c1e3c9b44f29649bc0431905411adbe2e939865464ac6319ffc8c63ed71fcebb23cc61d348df60cf7c681864ff89128ec13e@127.0.0.1:30303 --password node2/password.txt --allow-insecure-unlock ### What exactly were you doing when you encountered this issue? ...Give us some steps to reproduce... ### How were you accessing your wallet? ...Ledger, Trezor, MetaMask, Private Key, Keystore File, Parity Signer, Mnemonic Phrase?... ### Description of Your Machine - Browser: N/A - APP - Browser version: 10.15.2 - Operating system: macOSCatalina - Device: Macbook pro - MyCrypto.com vs Desktop Application? Desktop Application - MyCrypto Version Number: Version Release 1.7.4 ### Console Logs / Screenshots ...
